location: Molotov cocktails thrown into porch at rear of building
summary: 11/11/1993: Unknown perpetrators threw three Molotov cocktails into the Hillcrest Women's Medical Center in York, Pennsylvania, United States. The firebombs failed to ignite but did shatter windows and damage supplies resulting in $500 in damages.
motive: To protest the practice of abortion and to sabotage abortion facilities operating in Pennsylvania.
weapdetail: Three Molotov cocktails consisting of bottles filled with gasoline with birthday candles used as a wick
propcomment: Windows shattered.  Also, curtains and office were supplies damaged by gasoline.
scite1: "Gasoline Bottles Thrown into Abortion Clinic," Reading Eagle, November 12, 1993.
scite2: "Firebombs Hit Pennsylvania Abortion Clinic," Austin American-Statesman, November 12, 1993.
scite3: "Chronological History of Arsons and Bombings Against Abortion Providers," National Abortion Federation.
